AWS frees us up to innovate by taking
risks that might not have paid off in
the past the lower risk of releasing a

my name is Lauren kobashigawa Bates I'm
the technical director for Asia for
Expedia and specifically our joint
venture with Air Asia uh AAE travel we
were one of the earlier teams at Expedia
to be aggressively moving to AWS and you
know we did that because we were
building a new site and we're building
it in Asia and targeting a Southeast
Asian uh customer base and Expedia has
no data center Pres
uh on that side of the world and we
really wanted our application to be
close to our customers so using adus as
a hosting platform allowed us to get uh
the application closer to our customers
and off the ground uh incredibly fast
the first and the most important reason
we go with AWS is for the uh
self-service flexibility I mean the fact
that we can be up and running with a
test environment in minutes that we can
um try out new ideas and we don't need
to prch hardware for it um I think if we
had decided to to grow a a business size
of Air Asia go in Asia in a classic
Model I'd probably still be negotiating
data center
contracts across Expedia globally we um
were pushing more and more services that
we want to be closer to the End customer
into AWS and so we started with it just
looking at it as a hosting provider but
since then have moved on to using um a
number of other services we use SNS we
use sqs
um we use uh elastic load balancer we
use uh cloudfront uh we're certainly
heavy users of S3 on the global Expedia
side we have several vpcs uh across
multiple regions and in each of those
regions we have a test VPC and we have a
production VPC and those vpcs are
connected back to our data center so
that we can securely access our internal
Services the most important benefits
from AWS is definitely the flexibility
the ability to get our
application uh deployed and tested and
released to customers in 20 minutes an
example of that is the system we call
our Global deals engine we've migrated
to AWS so that we can have
it scaled out across multiple uh
multiple regions around the world and we
can get the interactivity that customers
are looking for so we can get uh
responses back to the customer in in
subsecond times ads allows us to get
experimental features to customers at a
very low cost which significantly
reduces the risk and allows us to take
bets on uh on things that otherwise we
wouldn't have necessarily made the
investment in uh as far as the future of
Hosting goes AWS completely knocked it
out of the park and uh I know I'm really
excited to see what you guys come out
with next
